body_html: @SsnL The reason that test works is because it is carefully crafted to not hit the corner cases of disabling the JIT partially. I think the issues that @apaszke is talking about arise mostly when the JIT is enabled for a declaration/trace of something but disabled when that same thing is used (or vice versa).

body: @SsnL The reason that test works is because it is carefully crafted to not hit the corner cases of disabling the JIT partially. I think the issues that @apaszke is talking about arise mostly when the JIT is enabled for a declaration/trace of something but disabled when that same thing is used (or vice versa).
